notifications.title: New training videos for Vaadin 14

notifications.body: The best way to learn to code is by coding. Vaadin is open source and free to use for any kind of web applications. In addition to this, we offer professional web developers Vaadin Pro, which adds more tools and components to increase productivity. We don’t want the price to prevent you from using and learning Vaadin during your studies and as a student, you can get access to these same professional tools for free.
notifications.title: Vaadin Pro available for students

notifications.body: Vaadin 14 LTS was released just a while ago and next week will be one of the biggest yearly events to present that to you. We’re happy to meet you at Oracle CodeOne conference in San Francisco, September 15 - 19. Come and visit us at booth 3127 to say hello, try out Vaadin and grab a fresh copy of Book of Vaadin.
notifications.title: Meet us at CodeOne 2019

notifications.body: I'm glad to announce that the new edition of the Book of Vaadin is now available and you can download it for free now at https://vaadin.com/book.
notifications.title: The Legendary Book of Vaadin is Back

notifications.body: Companies wanting to support Internet Explorer 11 should use Vaadin 8 or Vaadin 14. Vaadin 14 is a Long Term Support release, which means we will maintain it for free until June 14, 2024. Commercial support is available for an additional ten years, until June 14, 2034. Note that we will keep adding new features in the upcoming 14.x versions and our LTS promise covers those new minor versions too.
notifications.title: Vaadin 14 is the last major version to support IE11

notifications.body: Vaadin 14 is the latest LTS release of the Vaadin framework. It shipped tens of new features and enhancements and is the version that we recommend that all new users start out with.
notifications.title: Should you upgrade to Vaadin 14?

notifications.body: Vaadin 14 is finally out, but we still have miles to walk on our mission to simplify developer experience. Vaadin shines when it comes to data binding.  Mostly due to the architecture that allows you to put the Java UI code to the same execution environment as your services. But there are things we can do to improve this further.
notifications.title: Request for Comments - Lazy Data Binding Improvements

notifications.body: Vaadin 14 was recently released and is the next long-term support (LTS) version. It came with a bundle of new features which you can check out on the release page. One part of the added value is new web components and enhancements to existing components. Vaadin 14 includes 18 new components compared to Vaadin 10, which is the previous long-term supported version.
notifications.title: 18 new components in Vaadin 14 LTS

notifications.body: Vaadin 14 is the latest Long-term support (LTS) version of the Java web framework. Since the previous LTS version (Vaadin 10), we have released a lot of great features, like CDI support, dynamic route registration, Material theme, keyboard shortcuts, and 18 new components, to name a few. Assuming you have been following the releases during the last year, let’s focus on the top 14 new features introduced in Vaadin 14 in the past few months.
notifications.title: Top 14 new features in Vaadin 14
